page.title: 17Life on the Doniford Stream
page.content: The{Doniford Stream}has played an important part in the life of this block. There is still clear evidence of three{water mills}using the stream as an{energy}source. These are to be found at{Curdon, Providence and {Sampford Flour Mill. }This last mill was still used for the preparation of animal feeds between the wars. The Wildlife of the stream is rich and varied. Many people still think that it maintains one pair of {otters. }In fact{otterhounds}still work this stretch of river - not to hunt and kill the otter but to identify and protect their{holt. Near Sampford Brett this was to be found in an old drain. There are a number of varieties of{fresh water {fish}which attract the{heron}and for the lucky, or very observant, the {kingfisher.
